intro: Pentacalia aedoi, commonly known as the pink fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
